acr.title: Authentication context
acr.description: A value of 0 for the 'Authentication context class' claim indicates the end-user authentication didn't meet the requirements of ISO/IEC 29115.

acrs.title: Authentication context references
acrs.description: Indicates the Auth Context IDs of the operations that the bearer is eligible to perform. Auth Context IDs can be used to trigger a demand for step-up authentication from within your application and services. Often used along with the xms_cc claim.

acct.title: Account type
acct.description: Account type or status associated with the token.

aio.title: Azure internal token identifier
aio.description: An internal claim used by Microsoft Entra ID to record data for token reuse. Resources shouldn't use this claim.

amr.title: Authentication methods
amr.description: Identifies the authentication method of the subject of the token. See the docs for enums: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity-platform/access-token-claims-reference#amr-claim

app_displayname.title: Application display name
app_displayname.description: Display name of the application associated with the token.

appid.title: Application ID
appid.description: The application ID of the client using the token. The application can act as itself or on behalf of a user. The application ID typically represents an application object, but it can also represent a service principal object in Microsoft Entra ID.

appidacr.title: Application ID ACR
appidacr.description: Indicates authentication method of the client. For a public client, the value is 0. When you use the client ID and client secret, the value is 1. When you use a client certificate for authentication, the value is 2.

aud.title: Audience
aud.description: Identifies the intended audience of the token. In v2.0 tokens, this value is always the client ID of the API. In v1.0 tokens, it can be the client ID or the resource URI used in the request. The value can depend on how the client requested the token.

auth_time.title: Authentication time
auth_time.description: The time when the user was authenticated. This is typically used to determine how long ago the user was authenticated.

azp.title: Authorized party
azp.description: A replacement for appid. The application ID of the client using the token. The application can act as itself or on behalf of a user. The application ID typically represents an application object, but it can also represent a service principal object in Microsoft Entra ID.

azpacr.title: Authorized party ACR
azpacr.description: A replacement for appidacr. Indicates the authentication method of the client. For a public client, the value is 0. When you use the client ID and client secret, the value is 1. When you use a client certificate for authentication, the value is 2.

controls_auds.title: Conditional Access controls audiences
controls_auds.description: The audiences that the Conditional Access controls apply to.

ctry.title: Country
ctry.description: User's country/region. This claim is returned if it's present and the value of the field is a standard two-letter country/region code, such as FR, JP, SZ, and so on.

deviceid.title: Device ID
deviceid.description: Unique identifier of the device used during authentication.

email.title: Email
email.description: The email address of the user associated with the token.

exp.title: Expiration timestamp
exp.description: Specifies the expiration time before which the JWT can be accepted for processing. A resource may reject the token before this time as well. The rejection can occur for a required change in authentication or when a token is revoked.

family_name.title: Family name
family_name.description: Family name of the user associated with the token.

fwd.title: Forwarded ip address
fwd.description: Adds the original address of the requesting client (when inside a VNET).

given_name.title: Given name
given_name.description: Given name of the user associated with the token.

groups.title: Groups
groups.description: Provides object IDs that represent the group memberships of the subject.

groups:src1.title: Groups source
groups:src1.description: Includes a link to the full groups list for the user when token requests are too large for the token.

hasgroups.title: Has groups
hasgroups.description: Indicates whether the user is in at least one group.

iat.title: Issued at
iat.description: Specifies when the authentication for this token occurred.

idp.title: Identity provider
idp.description: Records the identity provider that authenticated the subject of the token. This value is identical to the value of the Issuer claim unless the user account isn't in the same tenant as the issuer, such as guests.

idtyp.title: Identity type
idtyp.description: Type of identity associated with the token (e.g., user, application).

in_corp.title: Inside corporate network
in_corp.description: Signals if the client is logging in from the corporate network. If they're not, the claim isn't included.

ipaddr.title: IP address
ipaddr.description: IP address of the client making the request.

iss.title: Issuer
iss.description: Identifies the STS that constructs and returns the token, and the Microsoft Entra tenant of the authenticated user. If the token issued is a v2.0 token (see the ver claim), the URI ends in /v2.0. The GUID that indicates that the user is a consumer user from a Microsoft account is 9188040d-6c67-4c5b-b112-36a304b66dad.

login_hint.title: Login hint
login_hint.description: An opaque, reliable login hint claim that's base 64 encoded. Don't modify this value. This claim is the best value to use for the login_hint OAuth parameter in all flows to get SSO.

name.title: Full name
name.description: Full name of the user associated with the token.

nbf.title: Not before
nbf.description: Specifies the time after which the JWT can be processed.

nonce.title: Nonce
nonce.description: A unique value used to associate a client session with an ID token, preventing replay attacks.

oid.title: Object ID
oid.description: The immutable identifier for the requestor, which is the verified identity of the user or service principal. This ID uniquely identifies the requestor across applications.

onprem_sid.title: On-premises security identifier
onprem_sid.description: The security identifier (SID) of the user in an on-premises Active Directory environment. This is used for hybrid scenarios where the user is synchronized from on-premises to Azure AD.

platf.title: Platform
platf.description: Platform identifier for the device used during authentication.
platf.$comment: 3 is likely web, maybe Windows. 5 is macOS. what is 14? 1-4 also exist. 8 from local az cli, maybe linux?

preferred_username.title: Preferred username
preferred_username.description: The primary username that represents the user. The value could be an email address, phone number, or a generic username without a specified format.

pwd_exp.title: Password expiration time
pwd_exp.description: The number of seconds after the time in the iat claim at which the password expires. This claim is only included when the password is expiring soon (as defined by 'notification days' in the password policy).

pwd_url.title: Change password url
pwd_url.description: A URL that the user can visit to change their password. This claim is only included when the password is expiring soon (as defined by 'notification days' in the password policy).

puid.title: Persistent unique ID
puid.description: Persistent unique identifier for the user.

rh.title: Refresh token handle
rh.description: An internal claim used by Azure to revalidate tokens. Resources shouldn't use this claim.

roles.title: Roles
roles.description: The set of permissions exposed by the application that the requesting application or user has been given permission to call.

scp.title: Scopes
scp.description: The set of scopes exposed by the application for which the client application has requested (and received) consent. Only included for user tokens. Space-separated.

sid.title: Session ID
sid.description: Represents an unique identifier for a session and will be generated when a new session is established.

signin_state.title: Sign-in state
signin_state.description: State of the sign-in process (e.g., managed device, compliant device). kmsi indicates user preference for Keep Me Signed In. inknownntwk indicates a public IP in a Conditional Access known network.

sub.title: Subject
sub.description: The principal associated with the token. For example, the user of an application. This value is immutable, don't reassign or reuse.

tenant_ctry.title: Tenant country
tenant_ctry.description: Resource tenant's country/region. Same as ctry except set at a tenant level by an admin. Must also be a standard two-letter value.

tid.title: Tenant ID
tid.description: Represents the tenant that the user is signing in to. For work and school accounts, the GUID is the immutable tenant ID of the organization that the user is signing in to.

unique_name.title: Unique name
unique_name.description: Provides a human readable value that identifies the subject of the token.

upn.title: User principal name
upn.description: User principal name of the user associated with the token.

uti.title: Unique token identifier
uti.description: Token identifier claim, equivalent to jti in the JWT specification. Unique, per-token identifier that is case-sensitive.

ver.title: Version
ver.description: Indicates the version of the access token.

wids.title: Roles or permissions
wids.description: Denotes the tenant-wide roles assigned to this user, from the section of roles present in Microsoft Entra built-in roles. The groupMembershipClaims property of the application manifest configures this claim on a per-application basis. Set the claim to All or DirectoryRole.

xms_aud_guid.$comment: audience GUID if aud is customised?

xms_cc.title: Client capabilities
xms_cc.description: Indicates whether the client application that acquired the token is capable of handling claims challenges.

xms_edov.title: Enterprise domain verified
xms_edov.description: An email is considered to be domain verified if it belongs to the tenant where the user account resides and the tenant admin has done verification of the domain. Also, the email must be from a Microsoft account (MSA), a Google account, or used for authentication using the one-time passcode (OTP) flow. Facebook and SAML/WS-Fed accounts do not have verified domains. For this claim to be returned in the token, the presence of the email claim is required.

xms_filter_index.$comment: Seen 31, 129, and 189 on user tokens. 66 on loki user token

xms_ftd.title: Federation token data
xms_ftd.description: Federation token data used for authentication.
xms_ftd.$comment: Trailing base64 region, like australiasoutheast-dsms or australiac-dsms. dSMS is Datacenter Secrets Management Service.

xms_idrel.title: Identity relationship
xms_idrel.description: Identity relationship data used for authentication.
xms_idrel.$comment: 1 appears to be users. 7 from apps, seemingly no pattern for training digit.

xms_pdl.title: Preferred data location
xms_pdl.description: For Multi-Geo tenants, the preferred data location is the three-letter code showing the geographic region the user is in.

xms_pl.title: User preferred language
xms_pl.description: The user's preferred language, if set. Sourced from their home tenant, in guest access scenarios. Formatted LL-CC (e.g., 'en-us').

xms_st.title: Federated subject
xms_st.description: Federated identity data associated with the token.

sub.title: Federated subject
sub.description: Subject identifier for the federated identity.

xms_tcdt.title: Token creation date
xms_tcdt.description: Timestamp indicating the creation date of the token.

ztdid.title: Zero-touch deployment ID (ZTID)
ztdid.description: The device identity used for Windows Autopilot.
